Assessment Title
Collector Name
Collector Phone Number
Collector Email
Is the Assessment Planned/Reactive or Other?
If other please state..
Which Key Stakeholder(s) have been engaged with during the risk assessment?

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SIGHTING_MEASURE_DOWN
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: Using a marker at a known distance

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SIGN_LOCATION
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: On the route a crossing user would take to cross the crossing directly

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SIGN_LOCATION
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: Not on the route a crossing user would take to cross the crossing directly

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SLEEPING_DOG_CRITERIA
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: There is no trace of a crossing at or in the vicinity of the mileage shown for the crossing.There is no trace of a crossing at or in the vicinity of the mileage shown for the crossing.

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SLEEPING_DOG_CRITERIA
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: The fence lines are complete on both sides of the line but there is no evidence that the crossing is used.

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_SLEEPING_DOG_CRITERIA
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: The fence lines are broken but there is no stile or gate provision and there is no evidence of persons crossing the line.

Internal Stakeholder (e.g. Signer, MOM, LOM) Please State...
Other (e.g. ORR) Please State...
Did the key stakeholder(s) attend the Risk Assessment?
If yes who attended?
If no why did they not attend?

Please state other reason why they did not attend:

CCTV (e.g. MCB-CCTV, covert equipment, local authority cameras)

Crossing Attendant/Keepers Records

Authorised User Site Visitor Log Book (e.g. Business, Farmer)

Enforcement Cameras (e.g. static camera equipment, mobile enforcement vehicles)

Signal Box Voice Recorders
Provide Details:
Other?

ns6:questions.ns5:text: What limits the sighting up
What limits the sighting down
How was the sighting measured up
How was the sighting measured down
What distance is the decision point from the nearest running rail in the up direction?
What distance is the decision point from the nearest running rail in the down direction?
What is the distance of crossing from decision point to 2m past furthest rail (m) in the up direction?
What is the distance of crossing from decision point to 2m past furthest rail (m) in the down direction?
Describe where you measured the decision point from in the up direction ?
Describe where you measured the decision point from in the down direction?
Notes on sighting and decision point<

Are there any obstructions that could make it difficult to observe trains (e.g. posts, scrap,redundant structures, equipment cabinets, signage etc) If yes add note of type and issue in Notes on how to improve sighting below.
Are there any other visibility issues at this crossing at certain times of the year (e.g. foliage growth)?
Is there any action to improve sighting
Notes on how to improve sighting
Are there whistle boards on the up line in the rear of the crossing
If yes, what is the distance (in m) to them?
Are there whistle boards on the down line in the rear of the crossing
If yes, what is the distance (in m) to them?
Notes on whistle boards including distance from crossing
Please provide any futher information that may be of use
Has there been or is there planned or apparent any development near the crossing which may lead to a change or increase in use such as a housing estate or change in farming practice
Notes on new developments

Are there any adjacent sources of light/noise (e.g. Road, Industrial Site, Airport) that could affect the crossing users ability to see or hear an approaching train? (If yes note type and issue in Notes section.)
Are the signs for the crossing located? (If not directly on the route a crossing user would use, make note in Notes section.)
Are the signs at the crossing positioned so as to be clearly visible for crossing users on a direct route over the crossing? (If no, note type of signs and any issue in Notes section.)
Are the signs for the crossing clearly visible during night/dusk? (If not visible make note in Notes section.)
Crossing approach notes
Notes on traffic utilisation
Is ice, mud, loose material or flood water a known problem at certain times
If yes, please describe
What is the road surface type?
Are there other known visibility problems at the crossing at certain times of the year (e.g. fog or foliage)
If yes, please describe
Has there been any user abuse of the crossing in the last year
Provide any additional information, such as history of abuse, effect of any mitigation measures that have been installed
Are the gates / barriers left open at the crossing

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_FOOTPATH_ENVIRONMENT
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: Work complex, business park, supermarket, hospital, school, caravan park or similar institution close by

ns5:selections.ns5:name: I_FOOTPATH_ENVIRONMENT
ns5:selections.ns5:displayValue: Provides access to rail locked residential property

ns6:questions.ns5:text: Are there any other operational disruptions due to the misuse of the crossing (e.g. for UWCTs are speed restrictions put in place in the event of phone misuse)
If yes please give details
What is the type of crossing surface? (Tick which on applies)
Type of decking enter either Timber, Concrete, Rubber or Other (describe):
Type of decking Other (describe):
Is the decking wide enough for all user types?
Does the decking have a non slip surface?
What is the traverse time from decision point to 2M past the further rail (s) for Pedestrians
What is the traverse time from decision point to 2M past the further rail (s) for Vehicles?
Has the traverse time been increased by 50% due to vulnerable users using the crossing?
Notes on traverse time
Is there a risk of a vehicle getting stuck on the crossing (consider the crossing surface and the type of vehicles that use the crossing)
If yes, please give details
Are the telephones used
If yes, please give details
Has the level of telephone use been confirmed with the signaller who controls the crossing
How often does a second train pass the crossing within 20 seconds of the first train
What is the chance that a second approaching train would not be seen until the first train has passed
Reasons for Mitigation
Percentage Cars Reduction
Percentage Vans / Small Lorries Reduction
Percentage Buses Reduction
Percentage HGVs Reduction
Percentage Pedal / Motor Cycles Reduction
Percentage Pedestrians Reduction
Percentage Horses / Riders Reduction
Percentage Horses / Riders Reduction
Percentage Tractors / Farm Vehicles Percentage
Train Passengers
Train Staff
Apply one value to all user types
